review: I prefer the Fire Stick over Chromecast (I have both). I find the remote control makes it much easier to use for both Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, and music. It would be perfect if it also had a the ability to stream from a browser the way Chromecast does. One annoying flaw is that when I use a USB port on my Samsung TV to power it, the TV wants to switch from the cable HDMI port to the Fire Stick HDMI port every time I turn on the TV.  This doesn't happen when I power it using the AC adapter. It may be a quirk of the TV, but I never had the same problem using USB power with the Chromecast stick. BTW, the first one Amazon shipped me had a malfunctioning remote. But they quickly replaced it for me. Great service.

review: I've used the fire stick this for several months and I must say I prefer it over Google Chromecast (which I also have) for the most part because I'm a Prime member. But I also prefer having a dedicated remote vs. using my phone of iPAd to control it. The one flaw is that when it's powered through a USB port on my Samsung TV, the TV sees it as primary and switches from TV to the Fire Stick HDMI port automatically. I then have to switch it back to TV. This isn't the case when I use the separate power adapter. I suspect that it's a quirk in my TV rather than the fire stick. I wish it would handle You Tube like the Chromecast.
